description: The Adani Group is confident of meeting the seven-year deadline to revamp one of Asia’s biggest slums despite a threat from the main opposition party to halt the project if they win in the state elections this year.
title: Adanis Stick With Slum Recast Plan Even as Dharavi Project Turns Political Hot Potato

description: The US, Qatar and Egypt are calling for a new round of cease-fire talks on Aug. 15, the latest attempt by the Biden administration to end the war in Gaza even as the region braces for an expected Iranian attack on Israel.
title: US Calls for Gaza Cease-Fire Talks Aug. 15 With Qatar, Egypt

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, senior writer for economics Shawn Donnan looks at the economies of the swing states that likely will decide the presidential election. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: A Dive Into the Economies of the 2024 Election Battlegrounds

description: In this Bloomberg Originals mini-documentary, we show how a big bet on the vice president to challenge Donald Trump may be paying off.
title: How Kamala Harris Is Recharging the Democratic Party

description: Advisers to the Biden administration stopped short of making any promises to crypto industry executives who voiced policy concerns, according to a participant on a Zoom call held Thursday.
title: Crypto Executives Voice Concern to White House Advisers on Conference Call

description: Vice President Kamala Harris doesn’t support halting arms shipments to Israel as a way to pressure Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s administration over the war in Gaza, a top aide to the Democratic presidential challenger said on Thursday.
title: Harris Doesn’t Support Halting Arms Flow to Israel, Aide Says

description: Mozambique’s former finance minister Manuel Chang was convicted of US charges that he was part of a $2 billion bond fraud scandal that ensnared Credit Suisse Group AG and triggered a financial crisis for the African nation.
title: Ex-Mozambique Minister Guilty of Fraud Tied to Credit Suisse

description: Kristen V. Brown is a reporter and editor on Bloomberg News’  health team, filling in for equality senior reporter Claire Suddath this week. You can subscribe here, and share feedback with Claire here.Also, we’d love to know what you think of the Equality newsletter. Please take our survey.
title: Access to IVF Treatments Is More Tenuous Than Ever

description: Republican nominee Donald Trump said that the president should have some say over interest rates and monetary policy, a move that would go against the longstanding practice of the US Federal Reserve being independent of political actors.
title: Trump Wants Presidents to Have Some Say Over Interest Rates

description: President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva will expel Nicaragua’s ambassador to Brazil, deepening a rift between the leftist leader and traditional ally Daniel Ortega, according to a person familiar with the situation.
title: Lula to Expel Nicaraguan Ambassador Amid Dispute With Ortega

description: Mozambican President Filipe Nyusi replaced Max Tonela, his finance chief, with Prime Minister Adriano Maleiane, the presidency said in a statement Thursday.
title: Mozambique President Replaces Finance Head With Prime Minister

description: Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump looked to recapture attention — and momentum — in his race against Vice President Kamala Harris on Thursday, dangling a series of debates and fielding questions for over an hour from reporters at his Mar-a-Lago resort.
title: Trump Pitches Debates With Harris in Bid to Reshape Race

description: Stealthy US Air Force F-22 Raptor jets have arrived in the Middle East in a show of force meant to deter Iran and its proxies from attacking Israel following the assassination of a top Hamas leader.
title: F-22 Jets Arrive in the Middle East to Signal US Support for Israel

description: Ghana’s Vice President Mahamudu Bawumia said he will adopt a new exchange rate regime that links the cedi currency to gold if he wins presidential elections in December.
title: Ghana’s Bawumia to Link Cedi to Gold If Elected President

description: Raucous crowds, musical guests and grand entrances: Kamala Harris’ campaign events are looking a lot like Donald Trump’s.
title: Harris Takes Page From Trump With Rallies Showing Party Fervor

description: It took just moments for Republicans to identify an attack line against Tim Walz, the folksy governor of Minnesota picked by Kamala Harris as her running mate in the presidential election.
title: Tim Walz Fields Republican Attacks Over Minneapolis’s Post-2020 Turmoil

description: Vice President Kamala Harris will return to the city where her political career started to introduce her new running mate Minnesota Governor Tim Walz to many of the San Francisco Bay Area’s wealthiest Democratic donors.
title: Kamala Harris to Tap Longtime San Francisco Network for Campaign Cash

description: The public finance desk at Wells Fargo & Co., Bank of America Corp., JPMorgan Chase & Co. and other Wall Street banks just sidestepped a potential ESG fight in Louisiana.
title: Wall Street Banks Score Win in Anti-ESG Louisiana Muni Debt Spat

description: Britain’s courts are suffering from their biggest backlog in history, as tens of thousands of cases wait to be heard. Prisons, meanwhile, are close to breaking point with 98.4% of places occupied, and ministers have been forced to release inmates early to free up space.
title: They Fought the Law and the Law Won: The Readout

description: A fast-spreading mpox outbreak in Africa is likely to be declared a public health emergency of continental security next week as the region’s chief health advisory body moves to invoke this power for the first time.
title: Africa CDC Plans to Declare Regional Mpox Outbreak an Emergency

description: UK spies are stepping up efforts to tackle cyber and artificial intelligence threats from hostile foreign states, including the sort of online manipulation that helped foment rioting across the country in the past 10 days.
title: UK Cyber Spies Plan AI ‘Lab’ to Counter Hostile State Threats

description: In the latest effort to devise a credible national currency, Zimbabwe in April replaced its dollar with the ZiG, short for Zimbabwe Gold. The new unit is backed by bullion and foreign currency reserves held at the central bank. It’s the country’s sixth attempt at establishing its own currency since 2008, when inflation crossed 500 billion percent, according to International Monetary Fund estimates. Not only did that render it worthless, it turned the unit into a global punchline: US Treasury sec
title: All About ZiG, Zimbabwe’s Latest Shot at a Stable Currency

description: Soon after war broke out in October between Israel and the militant Palestinian group Hamas, the Houthi rebels who control northwestern Yemen joined in. The Houthis, who like Hamas are hostile to Israel and backed by Iran, began disrupting traffic in the Red Sea by attacking ships there, provoking a military response led by the US and UK. The rebels also started flinging missiles and drones at Israel, which is separated from Yemen by about 1,500 kilometers (932 miles) at the closest point. They
title: Who Are the Houthi Rebels Attacking Israel and Ships in the Red Sea?

description: Canada’s independent business advocate says Prime Minister Justin Trudeau’s plan to reduce temporary immigration risks dire economic consequences, underscoring the pressures the government is facing as it tries to slow population growth.
title: Trudeau’s Temporary Resident Cap Risks Economic Harm, Business Groups Say

description: President Joe Biden’s administration is taking steps to accelerate project permits and reviews involving historic buildings, part of an effort to build out infrastructure and climate resiliency in American communities.
title: Biden Aims to Speed Up Historic Preservation Reviews in Projects

description: Keir Starmer’s favorability rating dropped to a level last seen before last month’s general election as a plurality of Britons believe the new prime minister did a poor job handling riots that have spread around the UK over the past 10 days.
title: Starmer’s Popularity Wanes as UK Riots Test Labour Government

description: President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva’s administration is considering giving up on its idea of increasing a tax on bank profits to offset a payroll break approved by Congress, the government’s whip in the legislature, Senator Randolfe Rodrigues, said according to CNN Brasil.
title: Brazil’s Lula Considers Giving Up on Bank Tax Hike

description: Ukraine’s top diplomat denied that his country had lent support to Malian separatist rebels who killed scores of government troops and Wagner Group mercenaries in clashes last month.
title: Ukraine Denies Aiding Rebels Who Attacked Malian, Wagner Forces

description: Somalia’s cabinet ministers approved an electoral law that will enable the implementation of a one-person, one-vote system in 2026.
title: Somalia’s Cabinet Approves One-Person, One-Vote System for 2026

description: Singapore Prime Minister Lawrence Wong pledged to “redouble efforts” to combat high living costs, including by strengthening social safety nets for the most vulnerable citizens.
title: Singapore to ‘Redouble Efforts’ to Keep Costs of Living Stable

description: Singapore’s leader warned of challenges ahead as politics in many countries take a “vicious turn.”
title: Singapore Sees Challenges Amid ‘Vicious Turn’ in World Politics

description: An alleged attacker detained by Austrian police on Wednesday had been planning to attack concertgoers at Taylor Swift’s show in Vienna with home-made explosives and knives, according to Austria’s intelligence chief.
title: Suspect Planned Bombing, Stabbings at Vienna Taylor Swift Show

description: Russia declared a state of emergency in a western region as Ukraine’s military launched what appeared to be its biggest incursion into Russian territory since the Kremlin’s war began more than two years ago.
title: Russia Declares Emergency in Border Region After Ukraine Assault

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Ukraine’s Surprise Incursion Into Russia Turns the Tables on Putin

description: Vice President Kamala Harris’ decision to pick the governor of a major farming state as her running mate has signaled to the shrinking US agricultural industry that its top issues may finally get some attention on the campaign trail.
title: Harris’ Vice President Pick Brings Farming Issues Off Backburner

description: Nobel Prize-winning economist Muhammad Yunus arrived in Bangladesh on Thursday ahead of the swearing in of an interim government that he will lead after student-led protests forced Sheikh Hasina to flee the country.
title: Nobel Winner Yunus Arrives in Bangladesh to Lead Government

description: US Ambassador to Japan Rahm Emanuel won’t be attending ceremonies to mark the Aug. 9 atomic bombing of Nagasaki over what he called a “political” decision by the city’s mayor not to invite Israel’s envoy.
title: US Envoy to Skip Nagasaki Bombing Memorial Over ‘Political’ Snub of Israel’s Envoy

description: Former Catalan President Carles Puigdemont appeared at a rally in Barcelona, returning to Spain after nearly seven years of self-imposed exile despite an arrest warrant against him for embezzlement of public funds.
title: Catalan Separatist Puigdemont Defies Court With Spain Return

description: Bangladesh is unlikely to hold the general elections so soon after Sheikh Hasina was ousted, as the caretaker government may look to carry out constitutional reforms first to ensure future polls are tamper-proof, according to a former top diplomat.
title: Bangladesh May Not Hold Elections So Soon, Says Former Diplomat

description: Kenyan President William Ruto appointed 19 ministers approved by parliament, even as citizens threatened to resume anti-government protests that have led to the killing of scores of people.
title: Kenya’s Ruto Swears in Cabinet in Shadow of Renewed Protests

description: Malaysia is gaining more heft in the global supply chain as Infineon Technologies AG opens a major semiconductor manufacturing complex in the country, the Southeast Asian nation’s leader said.
title: Infineon’s $8 Billion Plant to Boost Malaysian Chip Ambitions

description: South Africa is intensifying its work to address shortcomings in tackling illicit financial flows so that it can exit a global dirty-money list, a top official at the nation’s financial regulator said.
title: South Africa Intensifies Push to Exit Dirty-Money List

description: Eurogroup chief Paschal Donohoe said the prospect of a second Donald Trump presidency is an impetus for the European Union to prepare itself by making its economy less dependent on the US.
title: Trump’s Return Would Be ‘Serious Issue’ for Europe, Donohoe Says

description: Defiant supporters of a disbanded Thai opposition party pledged to form a new outfit to challenge the conservative establishment’s grip on power, setting the stage for more political turmoil in Southeast Asia’s second-largest economy.
title: Disbanded Thai Party Members Vow to Battle Old Guard for Power

description: Tokyo Governor Yuriko Koike fractured a bone in her knee after throwing out the first pitch at a Yakult Swallows baseball game when her foot slipped on the mound as the ball bounced its way to the plate.
title: Tokyo Governor Breaks Knee Throwing First Pitch at Baseball Game
